p: Reduction in blood indices of the untreated rats is an indication N. haje venom-induced haematotoxicity, because of the presence of phospholipase A2 enzymes. Phospholipase in venom are toxic to cells as they disrupt the structures of RBC membranes [ 34]. There was significant improvement in blood profiles of envenomed rats treated with high dose of extract partitions of M. oleifera. This result corroborated earlier studies that reported haematinic effects of M. oleifera against snake venom induced anaemia [ 19].
